DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name and drug code of a medication administered to a patient to which they have a hypersensitivity or allergic reaction after exposure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Hpersensitivity or allergic reaction in an individual after exposure to a medication or agent.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: Altered reactivity to an antigen, which can result in pathologic reactions upon subsequent exposure to that particular antigen.

Concepts.definition: An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: 2015 Edition Common Clinical Data Set - 45 CFR 170.102
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support MU Data Elements for ONC

ClassificationSchemeItems.longName: Meaningful Use 2015 Edition Common Clinical Data Set
